newsitem.title: ESTONIA: GOVERNMENT TO DECIDE 1998 BUDGET PRIORITIES.
newsitem.headline: GOVERNMENT TO DECIDE 1998 BUDGET PRIORITIES.

text.p: The government will tomorrow discuss the 1998 budget to make a decision on its budget priorities, Prime Minister Mart Siimann said on Wednesday.
"The government will pass judgement on political questions which means the priorities and spheres where the budget will grow more than average," Siimann told a news conference.
Siimann added that the finance ministry can only start setting concrete figures for different state budget institutions after the political decisions have been made.
The ministry proposed a 1998 state budget of 13.726 billion kroons, 9.7 percent higher than 1997.
The government has earlier said that its priority in the 1998 budget is regional policy.
